item.title: extRatum package example
item.description: This notebook provides an example of extRatum package In this example, I demonstrate the use of extRatum package. I use openly available geospatial data to calculate the area covered by water bodies in each National Park in England. #devtools::install("C:/Users/User/Desktop/extRatum") library(extRatum, quietly = TRUE) library(sf, quietly = TRUE) ## Linking to GEOS 3.8.0, GDAL 3.0.4, PROJ 6.3.1 library(dplyr, quietly = TRUE) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tmap, quietly = TRUE) Read data First, I read in the boundaries of National Parks in England, published by Natural England.
